DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text that describes a different or not previously mentioned code for an irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes of genetic material.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Concepts.definition: An irregularity in the number or structure of chromosomes, usually in the form of a gain (duplication), loss (deletion), exchange (translocation), or alteration in sequence (inversion) of genetic material.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval from T.Davidsen. mc 4/18/11
